channel.title: Can't access ssh local forwarded ports via the torbrowser
channel.description:
I have a "ssh -L port:host:port" kind of tunnel from Workstation9 to the outside localhost:port works just fine in icewiesel but in torbrowser it gives "Firefox can't establish a connection to the server at 127.0.0.1:port"
I suppose that's limited on a purpose or just a bug?

item.title: Can't access ssh local forwarded ports via the torbrowser
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
Bug (or missing feature if you want so) in Tor Browser, please see:

Whonix – 3 May 20

Tor Browser Basics

Using Tor Browser in Whonix ™. Anonymity vs Pseudonymity, HTTPS Everywhere, Torbutton, Protection against dangerous JavaScript, NoScript, Tips, Update Tor Browser, Browser Plugins, Change Language

Read full topic
item.source: Can't access ssh local forwarded ports via the torbrowser

item.title: Can't access ssh local forwarded ports via the torbrowser
item.dc:creator: Dani
item.description:
I have a “ssh -L port:host:port” kind of tunnel from Workstation9 to the outside
localhost:port works just fine in icewiesel but in torbrowser it gives
"Firefox can’t establish a connection to the server at 127.0.0.1:port"

I suppose that’s limited on a purpose or just a bug?
